pullRequest.body:
If `a :: l` is sorted under a transitive relation `r` and `r b a`, then `b :: a :: l` is sorted too.

---

maintainer merge

I think this can land as is, but defer to the maintainers

maintainer merge
Arguably this should be called `sorted_cons` to match `pairwise_cons`
I think this is more in line with lean 4, though
Then we should rename `pairwise_cons` too
Do you want to do that additional rename here? I don't.
Is that an uncontroversial rename? I can do it in a separate PR.

> I think this is more in line with lean 4, though

Revisiting, I don't know if I agree with this claim. I'll ping @YaelDillies for another opinion.
I agree. This should be `sorted_cons`
Please use `mem_cons` before `rintro`

```suggestion
nonrec theorem Sorted.cons {r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop} [IsTrans Î± r] {l : List Î±} {a b : Î±}
    (h : r b a) (ha : Sorted r (a :: l)) : Sorted r (b :: a :: l) :=
  ha.cons <| forall_mem_cons.2 âŸ¨h, fun _ hx => _root_.trans h <| rel_of_sorted_cons ha _ hxâŸ©
```
Out of curiosity, what does the `nonrec` keyword do?
It makes `.cons`  resolve to `Pairwise.cons` instead of the recursive `Sorted.cons`

Some name tweaks:
```suggestion
nonrec theorem Sorted.cons {r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop} [IsTrans Î± r] {l : List Î±} {a b : Î±}
    (hab : r a b) (h : Sorted r (b :: l)) : Sorted r (a :: b :: l) :=
  h.cons <| forall_mem_cons.2 âŸ¨hab, fun _ hx => _root_.trans hab <| rel_of_sorted_cons h _ hxâŸ©
```
This statement is backwards.

```suggestion
theorem sorted_cons_cons {r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop} [IsTrans Î± r] {l : List Î±} {a b : Î±} :
```
maybe?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/List/Sort): `List.Sorted.cons`
